alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 10:51AM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches below 6000 feet, 3 to 6 inches above 6000 feet, and 6 to 12 inches above 7500 feet. Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Localized gusts as high as 60 mph are forecast for downslope areas along the Mogollon Rim and in the White Mountains. Winds switch around to the north- northwest by Thursday afternoon, remaining gusty 20 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 3500 feet across northern Arizona. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow and intense snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous and icy conditions will impact Thursday evening`s commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage and localized power outages. Additional snow forecast from 10 AM Today to 5 PM Today: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Buffalo Pass 0 to 1 inches Dilkon 0 to 1 inches Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 1 to 3 inches Flagstaff 0 to 1 inches Forest Lakes 1 to 3 inches Ganado 0 to 1 inches Grand Canyon 0 to 1 inches Heber-Overgaard 1 to 3 inches Holbrook 0 to 1 inches Kachina Village 0 to 1 inches Kykotsmovi 0 to 1 inches Munds Park 0 to 1 inches North Rim 0 to 1 inches Payson 0 to 1 inches Pine-Strawberry 0 to 1 inches Pinetop-Lkside 2 to 4 inches Prescott 0 to 1 inches Prescott Valley 0 to 1 inches Saint Johns 1 to 2 inches Sedona 0 to 1 inches Seligman 0 to 1 inches Show Low 1 to 3 inches Snowflake-Taylr 0 to 1 inches Tuba City 0 to 1 inches Valle 0 to 1 inches Whiteriver 1 to 3 inches Williams 0 to 1 inches Window Rock 0 to 1 inches Winslow 0 to 1 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
